Unveiling E-commerce Scams in 2024: Protect Your Business & Customers The ever-expanding landscape of online shopping presents a double-edged sword for businesses: wider reach and increased vulnerability to fraud. In this post, we delve into the latest e-commerce scams plaguing 2024, using a recent case exposed by Travel by Dart's Sorin Mihailovici to illustrate how seemingly legitimate websites can steal millions. Mihailovici, known for his adventurous travel show, encountered a deceptive online clothing store while in Thailand. This incident highlights how these scams go beyond simple credit card theft. We'll explore the tactics used to create a facade of legitimacy, tricking customers into believing they're making secure purchases. From clothing and footwear to household goods, this breakdown equips you to identify red flags and safeguard your business and customers: https://lnkd.in/e99rR-HP #ecommerce #fraudprevention #onlinesecurity

Navigating Fraudulent Returns in Online Retail can be a nightmare! 😱 As online retailers continue to reshape the retail landscape, they face a growing challenge: fraudulent returns. The rise of convenient e-commerce has unfortunately paved the way for dishonest practices, impacting not only businesses' bottom lines but also eroding trust in online transactions. Trust is the cornerstone of any successful relationship, and in the digital age, it's a two-way street. Customers trust retailers to deliver quality products, and in return, retailers trust customers to make honest returns. However, when this trust is violated through fraudulent returns, it undermines the foundation of the entire e-commerce ecosystem. From falsely claiming items as damaged to returning used goods, fraudulent returns not only result in financial losses for retailers but also disrupt inventory management and strain customer service resources. Moreover, they breed skepticism among legitimate customers, leading to a vicious cycle of mistrust that threatens the sustainability of online retail. Addressing this challenge requires a multi-faceted approach. Retailers must invest in robust fraud detection systems powered by advanced analytics and machine learning to identify suspicious patterns and behaviors. Additionally, clear and transparent return policies coupled with stringent verification processes can deter fraudulent activities while fostering a sense of accountability among customers. Beyond technological solutions, building trust in online retail necessitates collaboration and communication across the industry. Sharing best practices and insights can help retailers stay ahead of evolving fraud tactics and collectively safeguard the integrity of e-commerce. Ultimately, trust is not just a currency—it's the lifeblood of the digital economy. By fortifying defenses against fraudulent returns and nurturing a culture of honesty and accountability, we can ensure that trust remains a steadfast pillar of the online retail experience, empowering businesses and consumers alike to thrive in an increasingly interconnected world. #smallbusiness #giveback #makingadifference #digitaltransformation #canadianinnovation #leadership #mindsetchange #supply #supplychain #procurement #procurementleaders #strategicsourcing #sourcing #logistics #management #business #linkedin #saving #supply #thinking #technology #tech #techcommunity #tech4good #techforgood #cleantech #sustainability #sustainability #startup #startups #startuplife #leadership #thankyou #timeconscious #buy #sell #ollow #followus #canada #canadians #sales #marketing

Retail returns and how fraudulent returns cost retailers $101 billion in 2021 according to a report from the National Retail Federation and Appriss Retail. The report estimates that returns amounted to $743 billion with a 14.5% return rate. Fraudulent returns made up 13.7% of all returns. Returning merchandise is expected to be even higher this year during the holiday season. Retailers are looking for ways to mitigate returns by shortening return windows, charging return fees, and limiting refunds to store credit. #retail #retailinnovation #retailindustry #retailtechnology #retailtech #nrf2024 #ai #generativeai #conversationalai https://lnkd.in/gF-6u2_n

Hey LinkedIn community! Let's talk about online marketplaces! These digital platforms have revolutionized the way we shop and do business. From e-commerce websites to apps, marketplaces connect buyers and sellers in one convenient space. But here's the best part: they offer convenience and accessibility for buyers, while allowing sellers to reach a wider audience. It's a win-win! Online marketplaces facilitate various transactions, from business-to-customer (B2C) to business-to-business (B2B). Some popular examples include Amazon, AliExpress, eBay, and Etsy. However, with the rise of online marketplaces comes a growing concern - fraud. In our next posts, we'll explore the issue of marketplace fraud and how identity verification can help prevent it. Counterfeit products continue to plague brands across all verticals, from luxury goods to software. Reporting on this spate of fakes, WWD spoke with Vidyuth Srinivasan, founder and chief executive officer of Entrupy, in a feature article on how the company's AI-powered authentication tool helps companies fight fraud. “When we started thinking about how we can build trust in transactions and help the market to have more trustworthy transactions, we saw so many different kinds of technologies and various methodologies," Srinivasan told WWD. "We said we want something that counterfeiters cannot break because there’s nothing to break. We wanted something that constantly kept pace with new counterfeits where we build something that can scale at any scale and learn and continue improving over time.” Read about Entrupy's efforts to fight counterfeits in the WWD feature here: https://lnkd.in/eG9m-PDJ

🚨 The rate of online returns is now officially growing faster than the rate of #ecommerce sales overall, driven by the rise in return abuse and return #fraud. And yes, that has major ramifications for #retail, according to Signifyd’s Chief Business Officer Indranil Guha But it’s not all doom & gloom! This holiday season, merchants can minimize legitimate returns by being transparent about product descriptions and shipping delays providing clear post-purchase communication. As for the bigger picture, merchants can’t continue to operate with a one-size-fits-all return policy. To combat abuse & fraud, retailers should use #data to inject different levels of friction into returns experiences, based on the who and the why behind each return. You can read the rest of Indy’s insights in this recent Forbes Technology Council piece: https://lnkd.in/gDdzirmR
